about.description:
The HTCondor Python bindings aim to expose a high-quality,
Pythonic interface to the HTCondor client libraries. They utilize
the same C++ libraries as HTCondor itself, meaning they have
nearly the same behavior as the command line tools.

name: python-htcondor
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.19.2
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
    name: python-htcondor
    version: 8.9.8
source:
    patches:
        - paths.patch
        - python-archlib.patch
        - python-no-libpython.patch
        - rpath.patch
    sha256: a52dbb68fc90170fde4285a39fa0ca8ea20c7a8e6361d5b70f9900c7b0125e15
    url: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/archive/V8_9_8.tar.gz
build:
    ignore_run_exports:
        - gct
        - libgcc-ng
        - libuuid
        - pcre
        - python
    number: 0
    string: py38h8019cc0_0
requirements:
    build:
        - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
        - _openmp_mutex 4.5 1_gnu
        - binutils_impl_linux-64 2.34 h2122c62_9
        - binutils_linux-64 2.34 h47ac705_26
        - bzip2 1.0.8 h516909a_2
        - c-ares 1.16.1 h516909a_0
        - ca-certificates 2020.6.20 hecda079_0
        - cmake 3.18.0 h5c55442_0
        - expat 2.2.9 he1b5a44_2
        - gcc_impl_linux-64 7.5.0 hdb87b24_14
        - gcc_linux-64 7.5.0 hf34d7eb_26
        - gxx_impl_linux-64 7.5.0 h1104b78_14
        - gxx_linux-64 7.5.0 ha781d05_26
        - kernel-headers_linux-64 2.6.32 h77966d4_13
        - krb5 1.17.1 hfafb76e_2
        - ld_impl_linux-64 2.34 hc38a660_9
        - libcurl 7.71.1 hcdd3856_4
        - libedit 3.1.20191231 h46ee950_1
        - libev 4.33 h516909a_0
        - libgcc-devel_linux-64 7.5.0 h42c25f5_14
        - libgcc-ng 9.3.0 h24d8f2e_14
        - libgomp 9.3.0 h24d8f2e_14
        - libnghttp2 1.41.0 hab1572f_1
        - libssh2 1.9.0 hab1572f_5
        - libstdcxx-devel_linux-64 7.5.0 h4084dd6_14
        - libstdcxx-ng 9.3.0 hdf63c60_14
        - libuv 1.38.0 h516909a_0
        - make 4.3 h516909a_0
        - ncurses 6.2 he1b5a44_1
        - openssl 1.1.1g h516909a_1
        - pkg-config 0.29.2 h516909a_1006
        - rhash 1.3.6 h14c3975_1001
        - sysroot_linux-64 2.12 h77966d4_13
        - tk 8.6.10 hed695b0_0
        - xz 5.2.5 h516909a_1
        - zlib 1.2.11 h516909a_1006
    host:
        - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
        - _openmp_mutex 4.5 1_gnu
        - boost 1.72.0 py38h9de70de_0
        - boost-cpp 1.72.0 h7b93d67_2
        - bzip2 1.0.8 h516909a_2
        - ca-certificates 2020.6.20 hecda079_0
        - certifi 2020.6.20 py38h32f6830_0
        - gct 6.2.1550507116 he9ae1f9_1
        - htcondor-classads 8.9.8 he1b5a44_0
        - icu 67.1 he1b5a44_0
        - ld_impl_linux-64 2.34 hc38a660_9
        - libblas 3.8.0 17_openblas
        - libcblas 3.8.0 17_openblas
        - libcondor_utils 8.9.8 h9cd45e6_0
        - libffi 3.2.1 he1b5a44_1007
        - libgcc-ng 9.3.0 h24d8f2e_14
        - libgfortran-ng 7.5.0 hdf63c60_14
        - libgomp 9.3.0 h24d8f2e_14
        - liblapack 3.8.0 17_openblas
        - libopenblas 0.3.10 pthreads_hb3c22a3_4
        - libstdcxx-ng 9.3.0 hdf63c60_14
        - libuuid 2.32.1 h14c3975_1000
        - lz4-c 1.9.2 he1b5a44_1
        - munge 0.5.13 h1a52d62_0
        - ncurses 6.2 he1b5a44_1
        - numpy 1.19.1 py38h8854b6b_0
        - openssl 1.1.1g h516909a_1
        - pcre 8.44 he1b5a44_0
        - perl 5.26.2 h516909a_1006
        - python 3.8.5 h4d41432_2_cpython
        - python_abi 3.8 1_cp38
        - readline 8.0 he28a2e2_2
        - setuptools 49.2.1 py38h32f6830_0
        - sqlite 3.32.3 hcee41ef_1
        - tk 8.6.10 hed695b0_0
        - xz 5.2.5 h516909a_1
        - zlib 1.2.11 h516909a_1006
        - zstd 1.4.5 h6597ccf_2
    run:
        - boost >=1.72.0,<1.72.1.0a0
        - htcondor-classads 8.9.8 he1b5a44_0
        - libcondor_utils 8.9.8 h9cd45e6_0
        - libgcc-ng >=7.5.0
        - libstdcxx-ng >=7.5.0
        - python >=3.8,<3.9.0a0
        - python_abi 3.8.* *_cp38
test:
    commands:
        - python -m pip install --no-deps --index-url nothing htcondor
    imports:
        - classad
        - htcondor
    requires:
        - pip
about:
    description: 'The HTCondor Python bindings aim to expose a high-quality,

        Pythonic interface to the HTCondor client libraries. They utilize

        the same C++ libraries as HTCondor itself, meaning they have

        nearly the same behavior as the command line tools.

        '
    dev_url: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor
    doc_url: https://htcondor.readthedocs.io/
    home: http://htcondor.org/
    license: Apache-2.0
    license_family: APACHE
    license_file: LICENSE-2.0.txt
    summary: Python bindings for HTCondor
extra:
    copy_test_source_files: true
    final: true
    recipe-maintainers:
        - duncanmmacleod
        - jasoncpatton

about.description:
The HTCondor Python bindings aim to expose a high-quality,
Pythonic interface to the HTCondor client libraries. They utilize
the same C++ libraries as HTCondor itself, meaning they have
nearly the same behavior as the command line tools.
